query: ociobakelut bake 3D LUT from ACES 1.3 OCIO config Rec709
answer:
Here are the typical ociobakelut commands to bake a 3D LUT for Rec.709 from an ACES (v1.3) OCIO config. Replace paths/names as needed.

First set the config
- export OCIO=/path/to/studio-config-v1.0.0_aces-v1.3_ocio-v2.x.ocio  (config naming per ACES 1.3 OCIO v2 releases). ([community.acescentral.com](https://community.acescentral.com/t/aces-and-arri-logc4-in-after-effects/5103?utm_source=openai))

If you’re on the OCIO v2 ACES configs (recommended)
- This bakes the ACES 1.0 SDR Video view for a Rec.709 (Rec.1886) display, from ACEScg:
  ociobakelut --inputspace "ACEScg" --display "Rec.1886 Rec.709 - Display" --view "ACES 1.0 - SDR Video" --format iridas_cube --cubesize 33 acescg_to_rec709_sdrv1_33.cube
  Notes:
  - Display name and view come directly from the official ACES OCIO configs (OCIO v2): “Rec.1886 Rec.709 - Display” with view “ACES 1.0 - SDR Video.” ([github.com](https://github.com/AcademySoftwareFoundation/OpenColorIO-Config-ACES/releases?EwEpfmtODV9yG=WC0oNgnziKoN))
  - Support for baking to a display+view in ociobakelut is provided via the --display and --view options. ([github.com](https://github.com/AcademySoftwareFoundation/OpenColorIO/issues/1323?utm_source=openai))

If you’re on the older ACES 1.x OCIO v1-style configs (with “Output - Rec.709” colorspace)
- Bake from ACEScg, using ACEScct as the shaper (good practice for 3D LUTs):
  ociobakelut --inputspace "ACES - ACEScg" --shaperspace "ACES - ACEScct" --outputspace "Output - Rec.709" --format iridas_cube --cubesize 33 acescg_to_rec709_33.cube
  - Those colorspace names (ACEScg, ACEScct, Output - Rec.709) are standard in the ACES 1.x OCIO configs. ([github.com](https://github.com/nfa-vfxim/ocio?utm_source=openai))
  - Example of baking to Rec.709 from an ACES config with ociobakelut (older naming: out_rec709) is shown here. ([community.acescentral.com](https://community.acescentral.com/t/example-test-for-preview-tier/3085?utm_source=openai))

Why shaper and how to choose formats/cube size
- OCIO’s baking guide explains when to use a shaper (e.g., ACEScct) and general ociobakelut usage. Common 3D LUT sizes are 33 for on‑set/monitoring and 65 for grading. Formats: iridas_cube (.cube), cinespace (.csp), houdini (.lut), etc. ([opencolorio.readthedocs.io](https://opencolorio.readthedocs.io/en/latest/tutorials/baking_luts.html))

- Tell me your input space (ACEScg, ACES2065‑1, or ACEScct), target LUT format (.cube/.csp/etc.), and preferred cube size (33/65). I’ll generate the precise one‑liner.
